content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs my computer, I received an error message when executing the "execute_shell" command with the argument of "command_line" set to "nano /home/atlas/release-notes.txt". The error message stated that "nano" was not found. As I, I requested to read the file "/home/atlas/release-notes.txt" using the "read_file" command with the filename argument.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command read_file returned: Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/atlas/release-notes.txt'"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.html", "question": "What are the new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)?"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) include over 11,294 new packages and updates to over 72% of the software packages in the distribution. It supports various architectures, including 32-bit and 64-bit PCs, ARM, MIPS, PowerPC, and IBM System z. The distribution includes several desktop environments, such as GNOME 3.38, KDE Plasma 5.20, LXDE 11, LXQt 0.16, MATE 1.24, and Xfce 4.16. Other new features include driverless scanning and printing, a new generic open command, control groups v2, a persistent systemd journal, a new Fcitx 5 Input Method, improved man page translations, improved support for alternative init systems, and kernel support for exFAT. The Debian Med team has also added new packages in the field of life sciences and medicine, with more existing packages gaining Continuous Integration support. \n \n Links: [\' (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-about.en.html)\', \' (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-installing.en.html)\', \'2.1. Supported architectures (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.html#idm120)\', "2.2. What\'s new in the distribution? (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.html#newdistro)", \'2.2.1. Desktops and well known packages (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.html#major-packages)\']'}]
"""
